svg.text: is another occasionally tricky vowel in Mandarin. In most cases, this vowel sounds
is not pronounced “ee” when it comes after
. In these cases, simply extend the sound you are already making with the consonant. For
) is pronounced similar to “sss,” not like “see.”
Once you have learned the pronunciation of simple finals, compound finals should not be
too difficult to pronounce. In the audio, each compound final is first pronounced by itself,
and then an example word is given. Where possible, the example words are taken from the
* In these finals the -an sound is pronounced so quickly that it sounds similar to the English “en” in “when.”
